curam.util.type
Class DateTimeRange

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.type.DateTimeRange
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<DateTimeRange>
public class DateTimeRange
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<DateTimeRange>

Holds a period of time bounded by a start date/time and end date/time. The start date/time is optional. If no start date/time is specified, then the date/time range runs from "the beginning of time". If the start date/time is specified, then the date/time range covers the start date/time but not the day before, i.e. the start date/time is "contained" within the date/time range. The start date/time is the first day in the date/time range. The end date/time is optional. If no end date/time is specified, then the date/time range runs to "the end of time" (or "until further notice"). If the end date/time is specified, then the date/time range covers the end date/time but not the day after, i.e. the end date/time is "contained" within the date/time range. The end date/time is the last day/time in the date/time range.

recordInEffectOn

public static <D extends DateTimeRanged> D recordInEffectOn(java.lang.Iterable<D> iterableDateRanged,
                                                            DateTime dateTime)
                                                 throws AppRuntimeException
Helper method to determine the single record "in effect" on a particular date/time. A record is "in effect" if its date/time range contains the date/time. An exception is thrown if more than one record is found to be "in effect".

Type Parameters:
D - the type of entity containing a date/time range.
Parameters:
iterableDateRanged - an iterableDateRanged object containing date/time-range entities.
dateTime - the date/time being queried.
Returns:
the single records "in effect" on the date/time specified, or null if none found.
Throws:
AppRuntimeException - if more than one "in effect" record found.

recordsInEffectOn

public static <D extends DateTimeRanged> java.util.Set<D> recordsInEffectOn(java.lang.Iterable<D> iterableDateRanged,
                                                                            DateTime dateTime)
Helper method to determine the set of records "in effect" on a particular date/time. A record is "in effect" if its date/time range contains the date/time.

Type Parameters:
D - the type of entity containing a date/time range.
Parameters:
iterableDateRanged - an iterableDateRanged object containing date/time-range entities.
dateTime - the date/time being queried.
Returns:
the set of records "in effect" on the date/time specified, or an empty set if none found.

sortByDate

public static <D extends DateTimeRanged> java.util.SortedSet<D> sortByDate(java.lang.Iterable<D> iterableDateRanged)
Helper method to determine sort the date/time-range entities passed in into ascending-date/time order.

Type Parameters:

Parameters:
iterableDateRanged - an iterableDateRanged object containing date/time-range entities.
Returns:
the date/time-range entities passed in sorted into ascending-date/time order.

todayOnwards

public static final DateTimeRange todayOnwards()
Creates an open date/time range starting on the current business date/time. NB we have a static method, not a static field, as in a long-running server, the value of "todayOnwards" changes each day!

Returns:
an open date/time range starting on the current business date/time.

contains

public boolean contains(DateTime dateTime)
Indicates whether this date/time range contains the date/time specified. A date/time range always contains its start and end dates.

Parameters:
dateTime - the date/time to query.
Returns:
whether this date/time range contains the date/time specified.

contains

public boolean contains(DateTimeRange dateRange)
Indicates whether this date/time range contains all the dates in the date/time range specified. A date/time range always contains itself.

Parameters:
dateRange - the date/time range to query.
Returns:
whether this date/time range contains all the dates in the date/time range specified.

isValidRange

public boolean isValidRange()
Checks whether the date/time range is valid. The start date/time (if specified) cannot be after the end date/time (if specified). Note that the start date/time and end date/time are allowed to be the same date/time - signifying a date/time range which covers a single day.

Returns:
whether the date/time range is valid.

newEndDate

public DateTimeRange newEndDate(DateTime newEndDate)
Sets the end date/time to the specified value and returns the updated date/time range.

Parameters:
newEndDate - the end date/time for the new date/time range
Returns:
a new date/time range which starts on the same date/time as this date/time range and ends on the date/time specified .

newStartDate

public DateTimeRange newStartDate(DateTime newStartDate)
Sets the start date/time to the specified value and returns the updated date/time range.

Parameters:
newStartDate - the start date/time for the new date/time range.
Returns:
a new date/time range which starts on the date/time specified and ends on the same date/time as this date/time range.

overlapsWith

public boolean overlapsWith(DateTimeRange dateRange)
Determines whether this date/time range overlaps with another, i.e. are there any dates which are in both date/time ranges.

Parameters:
dateRange - another date/time range to compare with this date/time range.
Returns:
whether this date/time range overlaps with the other date/time range specified.

validateEnded
